intro: Artemisia zhaodongensis, commonly known as the Zhaodong wormwood, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flower heads that are typically clustered in dense, spherical clusters. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in grassy areas and rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
